title: Why the Most Common Diversity Programs Don't Work
reason: The video helps share common mistakes that diversity programs make.

title: So you want to talk about race
reason: This book is extremely eye opening. The author shares a lot of personal stories dealing with race. The book helps build empathy.

title: Why Diversity Is More Important Than Meritocracy: Quotas, Talent, Wall Street
reason: Some interesting points on why we need to rethink our approach on improving diversity

title: Reducing Bias in Your Hiring Process
reason: Some helpful tips to reduce bias in your hiring process

title: 7 Examples of What Being an Ally at Work Really Looks Like
reason: Some helpful advice for being an ally to your colleagues at work

title: We Power Tech: Everyday Actions to Be a Better Ally
reason: A good conference talk about how to be a better ally

title: How to counteract 3 types of bias and run inclusive meetings
reason: A good article onn how to help run more inclusive meetings

title: Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking
reason: This is a helpful book on understanding to help be more inclusive for introverts

title: Turn the Ship Around!
reason: This is a helpful book for leading teams

title: How to Fix Your Tech Interview to Increase Diversity
reason: There are a lot of great ideas for improving tech interviews to be more inclusive

title: Brene Brown: The Anatomy of Trust
reason: This is an excellent talk on building and retaining trust

title: Better Allies
reason: This is an excellent weekly newsletter that provides 5 insightful tips each week

title: How to build (and rebuild) trust
reason: This is a great talk by Frances Frei on how to build trust with people

title: Reply All - Raising The Bar
reason: In this episode of Reply All they talk about how important it is to have a diverse team

title: Noisemakers
reason: This is a six part series that brings together women sharing personal experiences facing harassement, gender inequality, and pay in the workplace

title: Oprah’s SuperSoul Conversations - Malcolm Gladwell: Talking to Strangers
reason: Malcolm Gladwell discusses his new book, Talking to Strangers: What We Should Know About the People We Don’t Know. Malcolm examines his theory that prejudging people we don’t know can lead to dangerous consequences.

title: Brené Brown and Vernā Myers Discuss Inclusion and Diversity
reason: A great discussion about inclusion and diversity with Brené Brown and Vernā Myers

title: Cut it out—How to stop using weak language at work
reason: An article about how to be a good communicator at work

title: The Mistake Companies Make When They Use Data to Plan Diversity Efforts
reason: A useful article to help companies approach improve diversity efforts

title: 50 Ways to Fight Bias
reason: Some helpful tips for ways to fight gender bias

title: Everybody Matters: The Extraordinary Power of Caring for Your People Like Family
reason: This is a great book for helping build a culture of empathy in a company

title: How To Use They/Them Pronouns!
reason: A video to help show you how to use singular "they" in practice as well as giving tips for how to overcome the learning curve faster.

title: Front End Happy Hour - Bartending to everyone - Inclusive language
reason: A podcast episode explaining about practicing more inclusive language in tech.

title: Better Allies: Everyday Actions to Create Inclusive, Engaging Workplaces
reason: The Better Allies is a great read on how to help build a more inclusive environment.

title: Stamped from the Beginning - The Definitive History of Racist Ideas in America
reason: This is a FREE audio book that does a great job going in depth about the historical racism in America.

title: White Fragility
reason: A book that explores the counterproductive reactions white people have when their assumptions about race are challenged, and how these reactions maintain racial inequality.

title: Waking Up White
reason: This book explores race with the desire to understand the racial divide.

title: 13th
reason: This is an excellent documentary on Netflix that outlines the racism towards Black people in America.

title: When They See Us
reason: This 4 part series on Netflix is the story of the Central Park 5.

title: Let's get to the root of racial injustice
reason: A TEDx talk by Megan Ming Francis that traces the root causes of our current racial climate to their core causes, debunking common misconceptions and calling out "fix-all" cures to a complex social problem.

title: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time
reason: A TED Talk by Baratunde Thurston that explores patterns revealing our racist framing, language, and behaviors.

title: Birth of a White Nation
reason: A keynote speech by Jacqueline Battalora that offers a blow-by-blow description of the moment the idea of, and word for, “white” people entered U.S. legal code.

title: Code Switch
reason: This is a great podcast talking about various topics and conversations about race.

title: Parenting for the Future
reason: This podcast covers a lot of great topics around talking about racism with your children.

title: Throughline: American Police
reason: This podcast episode covers the origins of American policing and how those origins put violent control of Black Americans at the heart of the system.

title: Brené with Ibram X. Kendi on How to Be an Antiracist
reason: An episode of Unlocking Us podcast with Brené Brown interviewing Ibram X. Kendi about how to be an antiracist.

title: Seeing White
reason: A podcast that covers a lot of the historical events in America that have lead to racism in America.

title: Why the 'nice guy' penalty disadvantages all workers
reason: Research suggests that men are distrusted and passed over at work when they exhibit qualities stereotypically assigned to women. Fixing this would benefit all of us.

title: Front End Happy Hour - Live Inclusion Panel at Tech Know Day
reason: A good panel discussion with some great insights shared on diversity & inclusion in tech.

title: Closing the gap: A manager’s guide to advancing gender equity in the workplace
reason: Suggestions for managers to help reduce gender gaps in the workplace.

title: The complicated battle over unconscious-bias training
reason: Helping workers understand their implicit biases is helpful, in theory – but these programmes are controversial. Who’s right?

title: What’s the Difference Between Diversity, Inclusion, and Equity?
reason: The often-used terms diversity, equity, and inclusion have distinct meanings. Here’s why that matters, and how they work together.
